articles.title: Raul Castro Ruz Expresses Will to Boost Friendly and Cooperative Relations with DPRK
articles.content:
Raul Castro Ruz Expresses Will to Boost Friendly, Cooperative Relations with DPRK
 Pyongyang, July 2 (KCNA) -- Raul Castro Ruz, first secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Cuba, president of the Council of State and president of the Council of Ministers of Cuba, met and had a talk with the visiting DPRK military delegation at the building of the Council of State on Monday. The delegation is led by Kim Kyok Sik, chief of the General Staff of the Korean People's Army.
					 Raul Castro Ruz said that the friendly and cooperative relations between Cuba and the DPRK are based on special fraternal ties between Fidel Castro Ruz and President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 Leader Kim Jong Il further developed the friendly relations between the two countries, he noted, wishing the army and people of the DPRK greater success in the revolution and construction under the wise leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					
					 He said he got deep impressions during his visit to the DPRK. He expressed the will to boost the friendly and cooperative relations with the DPRK in the future, too.

articles.title: Talks between DPRK, Cuban Military Delegations Held
articles.content:
Talks between DPRK, Cuban Military Delegations Held
						
 Havana, July 1 (KCNA) -- Talks between the DPRK and Cuban military delegations took place in Havana on Sunday. 
					 Present at the talks from the DPRK side were members of its military delegation led by Kim Kyok Sik, chief of the General Staff of the Korean People's Army, DPRK Ambassador to Cuba Jon Yong Jin and the military, naval and air attache of the DPRK embassy and from the Cuban side Leopoldo Cintra Frias, minister of the Revolutionary Armed Forces of Cuba, and other officials concerned. 
					
					 Both sides informed the situation of their countries and exchanged views on boosting the friendly relations between the two armies and peoples of the two countries. 
					
					 The talks proceeded in a comradely and friendly atmosphere.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Un from Ministry of Revolutionary Armed Forces of Cuba
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Un from Ministry of Revolutionary Armed Forces of Cuba
						
 Pyongyang, July 2 (KCNA) -- The Ministry of the Revolutionary Armed Forces of Cuba made a gift to the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					 Minister Leopoldo Cintra Frias handed the gift over to Kim Kyok Sik, chief of the General Staff of the Korean People's Army, who is leading the DPRK military delegation on a visit to Cuba, on June 30.

articles.title: DPRK's First Vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs Leaves for Russia
articles.content:
DPRK's First Vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs Leaves for Russia
						
 Pyongyang, July 2 (KCNA) -- Kim Kye Gwan, first vice-minister of Foreign Affairs of the DPRK, and his party left here Tuesday to visit Russia.
					 They were seen off at the airport by Vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs Kung Sok Ung, Russian Ambassador to the DPRK Alexandr Timonin and Chinese Ambassador to the DPRK Liu Hongcai.

articles.title: WPK Delegation Leaves for China
articles.content:
WPK Delegation Leaves for China
						
 Pyongyang, July 2 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the International Affairs Department of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea led by Vice Department Director Kim Song Nam left here Tuesday to visit China.

articles.title: DPRK Delegation of Students Sports Association Leaves
articles.content:
DPRK Delegation of Students Sports Association Leaves
						
 Pyongyang, July 2 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Students Sports Association of the DPRK left here Tuesday to take part in the 27th Universiad to be held in Kazan, Russia. It was led by Jon Kuk Man, chairman of the association who is also vice-chairman of the Education Commission.

articles.title: Youth League Officials Tour Historic Site Associated with War
articles.content:
Youth League Officials Tour War-related Historic Site 
						
 Pyongyang, July 2 (KCNA) -- Youth league officials across the country toured the historic site associated with the Fatherland Liberation War on Tuesday after visiting the Kosanjin Revolutionary Site with the approach of the 60th anniversary of the victory in the great Fatherland Liberation War. 
					 Going round the command post of the Supreme Command where the great Generalissimo Kim Il Sung worked and other historic buildings and relics outside, they deeply grasped his personality as a peerlessly great man who victoriously led the war and defended the sovereignty of the country and demonstrated the spirit of heroic Korea before the whole world. 
					
					 The visitors were deeply impressed by historic data and relics telling stories that Kim Il Sung set forth the orientation and ways for postwar rehabilitation and construction, foreseeing the future of the country after the victory in the war. 
					
					 Then an oath-taking meeting was held in the education ground before the monument to his revolutionary activities. 
					
					 The reporter and speakers said that Kim Il Sung powerfully aroused the brave soldiers of the Korean People's Army and people in the sacred war for defending the country amid the crucible of the war, defeated the U.S. imperialists and brought about the historic victory with his unique strategy and tactics and Juche-oriented war methods. 
					
					 The history and tradition of the victory won by Kim Il Sung were successfully carried forward by leader Kim Jong Il, they said, and went on:
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK will surely achieve a final victory in the all-out stand-off with the imperialists thanks to the undying revolutionary exploits performed by Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and the dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un, brilliant Songun commander. 
					
					 They called on the officials and members of the youth league to carry on their dynamic struggle to eternally glorify the revolutionary careers and immortal exploits of the peerlessly great men of Mt. Paektu and accomplish the Juche revolutionary cause down through generations, united close around Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Okchon Revolutionary Site
articles.content:
Okchon Revolutionary Site
 Pyongyang, July 2 (KCNA) -- The Okchon Revolutionary Site, located in Pukchang County, South Phyongan Province, is the place where the  Korean People's Army had its Supreme Command for the first time in the days of the temporary strategic retreat on the part of the KPA during the Fatherland Liberation War (June 25, 1950-July 27, 1953).
					 President Kim Il Sung stayed there from October 16 to 20, Juche 39 (1950), working out a plan to open up a new phase for the war.
					
					 At a train evacuated in a tunnel, he took concrete measures to materialize the second-stage strategic line of the war and met senior officials of the army, the party and the state.
					
					 There, he handled many issues like formation of the second front in the enemy-controlled area, uninterrupted issue of publications and the livelihood of servicepersons and civilians.
					
					  The day after he left there, the U.S. warplanes raided the tunnel, leaving 46 traces of machine-gun shots at its mouth, which gives a glimpse of his clairvoyant insight.
					
					 Preserved there are an angling site, shallow well and open-air dining site.

articles.title: Vast Areas of New Lawn Created in South Hamgyong Province
articles.content:
Vast Areas of New Lawn Created in South Hamgyong Province
						
 Pyongyang, July 2 (KCNA) -- The people in South Hamgyong Province made energetic efforts to create about 700 000 square meters of lawn.
					 Officials in Hamhung City well organized the campaign to plant lawn seeds of a new variety in a scientific and technological way.
					
					 Thanks to such sincere efforts of the people in the city as putting humus and scorched soil on the ground and leveling field, seeding, spraying soil on the ground and watering, the sprouts successfully came out.
					
					 The people in Tonghungsan District created tens of thousands of square meters of lawn reminiscent of the green carpet in a short period of time in the streets after creating the ground of vast area for cultivating a new variety of turf.
					
					 People of the institutions and industrial establishments in Songchongang and Sapho districts and citizens in neighborhoods turned out in the campaign to spruce up their living areas.
					
					 The people in such cities and counties as Tanchon, Jongphyong, Pukchong and Hochon also came out for the campaign.
					
					 The provincial people's committee, the provincial art troupe, Hamhung University of Chemical Engineering and Sinhung Restaurant and other units that first finished the seeding are now concentrating efforts on cultivation of turf.
					
					 Each street, village and working site in the province is being face-lifted day by day.

articles.title: Japan Actively Supports U.S. Forces during Korean War
articles.content:
Japan Actively Supports U.S. Forces during Korean War  
						
 Pyongyang, July 2 (KCNA) -- Japan took an active part in the U.S. military actions during the Korean War (June 25, 1950-July 27, 1953) provoked by the United States. 
					 Soon after the outbreak of the Korean War, Japanese Prime Minister Yoshita set it as a government policy to make positive cooperation with the U.S. in its military actions.
					
					 Accordingly, the whole territory of Japan was turned into a launching and supply base for U.S. forces in the war, with all its ports used for U.S. warships.
					
					 As of January 1953, there were 220 U.S. barracks, 44 airports, 30 harbors, 79 training grounds and 116 communications facilities in Japan, 733 in all.
					
					 Most of warplanes and warships, mobilized in the Korean War, were based in Japan.
					
					 The Japanese newspaper Akahata on June 25, 1970 said during the war Japan supplied U.S. forces with weaponry, medical materials and food, worth 2.3-2.4 billion U.S. dollars.
					
					 On the U.S. order, Japan dispatched servicepersons from the "Imperial Japanese Army" to the war under the name of "volunteers".
					
					 They served as "advisers" and "military experts" in the U.S. army, or directly took part in battles.
					
					 Reuters was quoted as saying on July 27, 1950 that about 25 000 Japanese troops participated in the war.
					
					 Mine-sweeping in the Korean territorial waters was entirely tasked to Japanese.
					
					 For example, Japan played a key role in U.S. troops' landing on Inchon, ranging from preparations of the operational plan, shipment of U.S. troops and munitions to mine sweeping.
					
					 It handed over to the U.S. army the data on germ weapons, developed in the period of the 2nd World War by the Unit 731 under the "Imperial Japanese Army", and helped it to use them in the war.
					
					 Thus, Japan's participation in the war rendered the situation of the war worse.

articles.title: Ex-Commanders of U.S. Forces in S. Korea Flayed for Their Reckless Remarks
articles.content:
Ex-Commanders of U.S. Forces in S. Korea Flayed for Their Reckless Remarks
						
 Pyongyang, July 2 (KCNA) -- Former commanders of the U.S. forces in south Korea were recently reported to have made such reckless remarks that the 16-member "UN Command" is playing the role of a defensive mechanism; it has played a big role in maintaining stability and peace on the Korean Peninsula along with the U.S.-south Korea "Combined Forces Command" and the U.S. forces present in south Korea; and the UN does not want the dismantlement of the "UN Command".
					 Rodong Sinmun Tuesday in a bylined commentary observes in this regard:
					
					 The real criminal who put at peril the peace and the security on the Korean Peninsula is none other than the U.S. What former commanders said is, therefore, just a sleight of hand to divert elsewhere the international community's criticism of the U.S. and shirk off such criminal responsibility.
					
					 Their remarks are also just a far-fetched assertion because the U.S. can not prove the legality of the "UN Command" by law.
					
					 Now the Korean Peninsula is in such a serious situation of whether war or peace as U.S. forces are present in south Korea under the disguise of the "UN Command".
					
					 People are becoming increasingly stronger in their voices calling for the dismantlement of the Command and the pullout of the U.S. forces. They are saying that unless the hotbed of war is eradicated from the international arena, the peace and the security on the peninsula can never be ensured.
					
					 The present U.S. authorities, however, are screwing up the tensions on the Korean Peninsula by resorting to aggression and provocation moves to stifle the DPRK by making the use of the command, far from dismantling it.
					
					 Whether the U.S. dismantles the command and pulls its forces out of south Korea or not serves as a touchstone showing whether it truly wants peace and stability on the peninsula or not.
					
					 The U.S. should not resort to such a trick but immediately dismantle the command and withdraw its forces from south Korea.

articles.title: Japanese Reactionaries' Militaristic Moves under Fire
articles.content:
Japanese Reactionaries' Militaristic Moves under Fire
						
 Pyongyang, July 2 (KCNA) -- The U.S. chief executive some days ago stated his view to keep offering the "nuclear deterrent" to Japan. As regards this the chief Cabinet Secretary and foreign minister of Japan respectively made such flattering remarks that they really feel secured and Japan will tighten alliance with the U.S.
					 Minju Joson Tuesday says this in a bylined commentary.
					
					 Herein lies Japan's cunning calculation and trick to step up the moves for turning it into a military power and rounding off preparations for reinvasion under its master's "nuclear umbrella", the commentary discloses, saying this is what they have pursued from long ago.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries as ever plan to not only keep nuclear weapons of the U.S. after shipping them into Japan but also make serious efforts to turn Japan into a military giant and launch overseas aggression under the U.S. protection.
					
					 So the Japanese reactionaries, feeling grateful, kowtowed to their master U.S. when it said it would keep offering "nuclear deterrent" to Japan, being considerate of what Japan had in mind.
					
					 But they should clearly know that their stepped-up moves will never lighten the future of Japan.
					
					 It is a wild fancy to think that the nuclear weapons of the U.S. will guarantee the security of Japan 100 percent.
					
					 Running headlong into turning Japan into a military power with the backing of nuclear weapons of the U.S. is a dangerous gambling bringing ruin to Japan.
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries should stop the foolish and reckless moves and behave with reason, mindful that their acts will bring ruin.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Denounces S. Korean Authorities for Branding Pro-Reunification Patriots as "Wartime Abductees"
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Denounces S. Korean Authorities for Branding Pro-Reunification Patriots as "Wartime Abductees"
						
 Pyongyang, July 2 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet authorities recently branded Kim Kyu Sik and hundreds of other pro-reunification patriots as "wartime south Korean abductees" on the occasion of June 25, the day of the start of the Korean War. 
					 This is another unpardonable reckless move to escalate the confrontation with the DPRK. 
					
					 As for Kim Kyu Sik, he took part in the Joint Conference of Representatives of Political Parties and Social Organizations in North and South Korea held in Pyongyang in April 1948. He bravely fought against the moves of the U.S. imperialists and their stooges to partition the country and ignite a war after going back to south Korea.
					
					 He came to the north in September 1950 and devoted himself to the struggle for national reunification till the last moments of his life. He took the genuine patriotic road of national reunification after putting an end to his checkered career. 
					
					 All Koreans in the north and the south know well about this as well as the lives of Ryo Un Hyong and Kim Ku who took the same path. 
					
					 The south Korean authorities branded Kim Kyu Sik and hundreds of others who came to the north as "wartime abductees" despite all these stark facts. This clearly indicates what an extreme phase they have reached in their anti-DPRK confrontation hysteria. 
					
					 It is nonsensical for them to claim that the DPRK abducted a lot of people and took to the north during the war though they were patriotic personages who voluntarily came here. 
					
					 The action taken by them against these fair-minded personages is an intolerable insult to them and their families and the DPRK and another despicable provocation. 
					
					 By hyping the issue of "wartime abductees" as another "human rights issue in the north", the south Korean authorities try to escalate their anti-DPRK human rights campaign in the international arena and create complexity in the north-south relations. 
					
					 This is nothing but a sinister attempt to defame the pro-reunification patriots and tarnish the image of the DPRK. 
					
					 "Abductees by the north" and "ROK army POWs" touted by them so far are a product of such scenario of the puppet group.
					
					 The south Korean authorities are sadly mistaken if they thank they can attain their ulterior purpose through these poor charades and moves to escalate the confrontation. 
					
					 They will only bring into bolder relief their true colors as diehard confrontation-minded elements and touch off rebuff and condemnation among all Koreans and all other conscientious people of the world. 
					
					 The south Korean puppet group had better face up to the trend of the times and behave itself.

articles.title: GIs Crimes Unabated in South Korea
Actions Staged against IS in S. Korea
articles.content:
Actions Staged against IS in S. Korea 
						
 Pyongyang, July 2 (KCNA) -- The Federation of University Students of south Korea held a candlelight meeting in Seoul on June 30 in denunciation of the Intelligence Service (IS).
					 It was attended by hundreds of students and citizens.
					
					 The participants said that they staged the action as they could not pardon those who committed fraudulent election without hesitation, declaring "they cannot recognize the president produced by the IS".
					
					 When riot police suppressed the protesters,　they　loudly shouted "Arrest liar Kim Yong Phan!"
					
					 The Ssangyong Motors Branch under the Metal Trade Union took part in the candlelight meeting that day.
					
					 Members of civic organizations in the area of Kwangju including the Kwangju Solidarity for Progress and citizens and members of opposition parties held a meeting on the same day before Kwangju Railway Station denouncing the IS.
					
					 Speakers called for certainly judging the present regime that seized power by an illegal method and dismantling the IS, a servant of the dictator.
					
					 They declared they would struggle against the scandal of the ruling forces with candlelight. 
					
					 At the end of the meeting, the participants staged a demonstration.

articles.title: Meeting of Young Koreans Held in Tokyo
articles.content:
Meeting of Young Koreans Held in Tokyo
						
 Tokyo, June 30 (KNS-KCNA) -- The 2013 meeting of pace-setters of the Korean Youth League in Japan was held in Tokyo on June 23.
					 Discussed at the meeting was the issue for the youth league to fulfill its role in opening up a new heyday of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) by accelerating the mass movement, keeping pace with the youth in the homeland.
					
					 Shown at the meeting was a video dealing with the people in the homeland who are turning out in a general drive for building a thriving socialist nation.
					
					 Nam Sung U, vice-chairman of the Central Standing Committee of Chongryon, in his speech said the dear respected Kim Jong Un is wisely leading the drive to create the "Masikryong Speed" and bring about a new heyday on all fronts of socialist construction after setting forth the strategic line on simultaneously pushing forward economic construction and the building of nuclear force.
					
					 Kim Cha Dol, chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the youth league, in a report called upon the officials of the league to work with transparent outlook on the masses and compatriots, strengthen the single-minded unity of the ranks and achieve a harmonious whole of the league members and thus build a harmonious and thriving community of Koreans in a responsible manner.
					
					 Videos introducing the activities of the organizations of the league for the development of the community of the compatriots and improvement of the national education were shown at the meeting.
					
					 At the end of the meeting there was a get-together.

articles.title: Koreans in U.S. Protest Election Fraud in South Korea
articles.content:
Koreans in U.S. Protest Election Fraud in South Korea
						
 Pyongyang, July 2 (KCNA) -- Koreans in the United States held a rally to denounce the Intelligence Service of south Korea in front of the south Korean consulate general in Los Angeles on June 29.
					 Speakers at the rally said they could not repress resentment at the IS's illegal interference in the "presidential election" in south Korea.
					
					 They declared its interference was a well-organized coup staged by an agency to seize "power".
					
					 They demanded the present puppet regime in south Korea own responsibility for rigging the election and the whole cabinet step down, terming Park Geun Hye's election invalid.
					
					 Many Koreans' organizations in the U.S. are now staging actions after forming organizations, they noted, and went on: On June 27 their representatives visited the south Korean consulate general in Los Angeles to thrust a letter of protest to it.
					
					 Koreans in the eastern part of the U.S. are kicking off a campaign to denounce the IS for its illegal action while putting ads on newspapers.
					
					 The speakers declared they would not cease their actions until the south Korean authorities make an apology for the illegal fraudulent election and the present chief executive steps down.
					
					 The rally was followed by a demonstration.

articles.title: Korean People's Efforts for Reunification Supported in Cuba
articles.content:
Korean People's Efforts for Reunification Supported in Cuba
						
 Pyongyang, July 2 (KCNA) -- An opening ceremony of the month of solidarity with the Korean people took place at the Cuba-DPRK Friendship Poultry Breeding Farm on June 25.
					 On display at the venue of the ceremony were photos documenting the undying feats of President Kim Il Sung in the Fatherland Liberation War, the Songun exploits of leader Kim Jong Il and the revolutionary activities of the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Present there on invitation were officials of the Cuban Committee for Supporting Korea's Reunification, the Cuban Institute of Friendship with the Peoples and the farm and other people. The DPRK ambassador to Cuba and staff members of his embassy were invited there.
					
					 Juan Jose Leon Vega, first vice-chairman of the Cuban Committee for Supporting Korea's Reunification, said as follows:
					
					 63 years have passed since the U.S. imperialists ignited a war against the DPRK by instigating the south Korean puppet forces on June 25, 1950.
					
					 The Korean army and people honorably defended the country by displaying the spirit of defending the fatherland and matchless bravery under the wise leadership of the President.
					
					 The war ended but the Korean people are still suffering misfortune and pain.
					
					 We will make positive efforts for Korea's independent and peaceful reunification to which Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il dedicated their whole lives and Kim Jong Un is devoting all his energies.
					
					 Cuba and the DPRK stand together in the anti-imperialist joint front.
					
					 The U.S. imperialists can never break the will of the two peoples.
					
					 We send invariable support and solidarity to the Korean people in their struggle for the country's independent and peaceful reunification.

articles.title: Korean People's Victory in War to Be Celebrated in Sweden
articles.content:
Korean People's Victory in War to Be Celebrated in Sweden
						
 Pyongyang, July 2 (KCNA) -- A Swedish preparatory committee was inaugurated on June 25 to celebrate the 60th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the great Fatherland Liberation War.
					 Christer Lundgren, chairman of the Sweden-Korea Friendship Association, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee decided to introduce the heroic struggle of the army and people of the DPRK, indict the U.S. imperialists for their brutal atrocities and raise the voices calling for the withdrawal of the U.S. forces from south Korea, dismantlement of the "UN Command" and conclusion of peace agreement from June 25 to July 27.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Work Brought Out in Booklet in France
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Work Brought Out in Booklet in France
						
 Pyongyang, July 2 (KCNA) -- President Kim Il Sung's work "Let Us Achieve the Great Unity of Our Nation" was brought out in booklet by the Democrate Publishing House in France.
					 The work published on August 1, Juche 80 (1991) clarifies the idea that the driving force of the national reunification is the Korean nation. It sets forth the tasks to be carried out to achieve the great unity of the entire nation and ways to do so.
					
					 The book-releasing ceremony took place at the publishing house on June 23.

articles.title: U.S. Forces in S. Korea Are Cause of Misfortune: Organizations
articles.content:
U.S. Forces in S. Korea Are Cause of Misfortune: Organizations
						
 Pyongyang, July 2 (KCNA) -- The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy, the British Group for the Study of the Juche Idea and the British Branch of the Korean Friendship Association made public a joint statement on June 17, 11 years since the U.S. troops present in south Korea brutally killed schoolgirls Sim Mi Son and Sin Hyo Sun.
					 Recalling that GIs drove an armored car over the two south Korean schoolgirls to death 11 years ago, the statement said:
					
					 If they had been alive, they would have enjoyed a full measure of their hopeful lives. But they lost their lives by the U.S. imperialist aggressors.
					
					 No GI, however, has ever been punished for the killing.
					
					 As shown by the fate of the two schoolgirls, the U.S. imperialists are the sworn enemy of the Korean people.
					
					 Now the U.S. military presence in south Korea has become a matter neither tolerable nor allowable for the south Koreans.
					
					 The U.S. forces in south Korea are the root cause of misfortune and pain.
					
					 The statement called for bringing to light the crimes by GIs, punishing the criminals and repealing the unequal SOFA.
					
					 It urged the U.S. troops to pull out of south Korea at once and without condition.

articles.title: U.S. Compels DPRK to Access Nukes: Organization
articles.content:
U.S. Compels DPRK to Access Nukes: Organization
						
 Pyongyang, July 2 (KCNA) -- The general secretary of the France-Korea Friendship Association denounced the U.S. for its hostile policy toward the DPRK, when interviewed by a Cameroonian broadcasting service on June 14.
					 The general secretary said:
					
					 The DPRK has powerful military capabilities whose sole mission is deterrence against the U.S. troops in Northeast Asia.
					
					 It has deterrent means enough to cope with the threat from the U.S. and south Korea.
					
					 It shaped the policy of nuclear force as the peace has not been ensured on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 It urged the U.S. to replace the Armistice Agreement by a peace accord so as to establish permanent peace mechanism.
					
					 The Korean issue spawned because of the U.S. persistent and deliberate hostile policy toward the DPRK, not because of the DPRK's interests in nukes.
					
					 The U.S. refuses to recognize the social system in the DPRK, infringing upon its sovereignty.
					
					 It worked out a scenario of compelling the DPRK to possess nukes and creating a terror-ridden atmosphere in south Korea by causing a chain reaction.
					
					 Meanwhile, the Nepali paper Charcha on June 17 carried an article titled "Justice wins" which said the U.S. reckless nuclear threat to the DPRK, a nuclear weapons state, pushed the latter close to a nuclear war.

articles.title: Korean People's Just Cause Supported in Nepal
articles.content:
Korean People's Just Cause Supported in Nepal
						
 Pyongyang, July 2 (KCNA) -- Nepali organizations issued a joint statement on June 27 to mark the beginning of the month of the international solidarity with the Korean people. They are the Nepalese National Memorial Committee for President Kim Il Sung and Leader Kim Jong Il, Nepal Journalist Association for the Study of the Juche Idea and Songun Politics, Nepal-Korea Friendship Association, Nepalese Committee for Promotion of Reunification of Korea, Afro-Asian People's Solidarity Committee of Nepal, Nepal Institute for the Juche Studies, Nepalese Association for Supporting the Songun Politics, Nepal Journalist Association, National Press Club of Nepal, International Committee for the Study of Songun Politics for Peaceful Reunification of Korea in Nepal, Study Forum for Self-Reliance of Nepal, Nepal Women's Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea and the Nepali Literary Forum for the Study of Songun Politics.
					 The statement said the progressive mankind is expressing solidarity with the Korean people in their just cause for the country's independent and peaceful reunification and the building of a thriving socialist nation. The statement went on:
					
					 The heroic Korean people showed before the world the truth that when a country gets united and exerts serious efforts to defend justice, it can protect its sovereignty and dignity.
					
					 We demand the U.S. cancel the hostile policy toward the DPRK and ease tensions in a peaceful way.
					
					 The Korean Peninsula reunification should be reunified in line with the historic June 15 North-South Joint Declaration and the October 4 declaration and on the basis of the three principles of national reunification laid down in the July 4 joint statement.
					
					 The U.S. troops in south Korea under the helmet of the "UN Forces" should be pulled out at an early date.
					
					 We hope that the Korean people will certainly realize the country's independent and peaceful reunification by their own efforts in firm unity.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un visita el Museo Conmemorativo de Victoria en Guerra de Liberacion de Patria
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un visita el Museo Conmemorativo de Victoria en Guerra de Liberacion de Patria
						
Pyongyang, 2 de julio (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, recorrio el Museo Conmemorativo de la Victoria en la Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria en visperas de inauguracion.
					En el monumento a la victoria en guerra, la exhibicion de armas benemeritas, el museo conmemorativo de la victoria en guerra y otros puntos, hizo conocimiento detallado del estado de construccion y exhibicion de datos historicos y objetos.
					
					Se ha hecho bien la ejecucion de jamba de que se puede decir que es la cara del museo, expreso y agrego que el monumento fue construido de modo original en lo plastico y artistico.
					
					Subrayo que la exhibicion al aire libre se ha hecho un museo a la intemperie que brinda confort a los visitantes permitiendoles conocer los meritos de nuestro ejercito y la derrota de los enemigos.
					
					Seguidamente, realizo un recorrido por el Museo Conmemorativo de la Victoria en la Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria.
					
					Viendo el hall del museo donde se va a colocar la estatua del Presidente Kim Il Sung en posicion de pie y los datos, la gran escena panoramica, los objetos, las obras artisticas, las fotos y otros exhibidos en varias salas, pasillo y paredes, dijo que todo el espacio del museo se convirtio en una base de educacion y agrego que fue muy buena la decision del partido de reconstruir el museo.
					
					Se mostro muy complacido de que gracias a la lucha energica de los constructores militares y a los esfuerzos de los funcionarios de ramas interesadas, creadores e investigadores academicos, el museo se haya acondicionado magnificamente como lugar que transmite las hazanas del Presidente realizadas por la victoria en guerra y como base de educacion clasista antijaponesa y antiyanqui y centro de educacion en las tradiciones de victoria.
					
					Destaco que el museo es un patrimonio eterno de la revolucion coreana que transmitira a todas las generaciones venideras la extraordinaria inteligencia militar, la destacada idea militar y las inmortales hazanas por la victoria en guerra del Generalisimo Kim Il Sung, comandante de acero quien libero la patria y defendio la soberania de la nacion derrotando en un siglo a dos fuertes enemigos imperialistas.
					
					Le acompanaron en esta ocasion Choe Hwi, Pak Thae Song, Hwang Pyong So, Hong Yong Chil, Ma Won Chun, Yun Tong Hyon, Pak Jong Chon y Ju To Hyon.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un recorre cementerio de martires del EPC en etapa de culminacion
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un recorre cementerio de martires del EPC en etapa de culminacion
Pyongyang, 2 de julio (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, recorrio el cementerio de martires del EPC en etapa de culminacion.
					El cementerio, que se construye en la entrada del capitalino barrio Ryonmot, esta formado de la jamba, la lapida de proposiciones, la otra de poesia dedicatoria, el monumento, la plataforma de deposito de cestos de flores, las tumbas de martires, etc.
					
					Parado ante la jamba, el Mariscal aprecio la construccion peculiar de ella y dijo que los anos "1950" y "1953", inscritos en las columnas de piedra en forma de la bandera del partido y la nacional en flameo, insinuan visualmente que se trata del cementerio de martires participantes en la Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria.
					
					Agrego que los martires del EPC, que realizaron meritos en esa guerra, buscaron su eternidad en el regazo del PTC y la RPDC.
					
					Al ver el monumento levantado en la parte centrica del cementerio, dijo que esta muy buena la forma del monumento, en que se combinan el fusil, bayoneta y bandera nacional, y esa le hace imaginar la bandera nacional flameando.
					
					Cuando llego al reparto de tumbas en forma semicircular donde seran enterrados los martires, recordo que desde la antiguedad, cada tumba tiene su dueno y anadio que el PTC es el propietario de las tumbas de los martires conocidos y desconocidos caidos en la pasada guerra coreana.
					
					Pasando por las dos lapidas, instruyo inscribir bien las proposiciones del Presidente Kim Il Sung y los versos en memoria de los martires.
					
					Al hacer conocimiento del estado de reforestacion del lugar, indico crear mas zonas verdes en el patio de educacion ampliando asi el area verde general.
					
					Y averiguo el estado de propaganda visual de los constructores militares movilizados en la obra.
					
					Apunto que hace falta acondicionar bien las tumbas de martires del EPC no solo en la ciudad de Pyongyang sino en todas las capitales provinciales para sembrar en las nuevas generaciones y los habitantes las hazanas de lucha del ejercito y el pueblo de Corea y su heroismo masivo y patriotismo, hechas y demostrados en la guerra coreana.
					
					Le acompanaron en esta visita Choe Hwi, Pak Thae Song, Hwang Pyong So, Hong Yong Chil, Ma Won Chun, Yun Tong Hyon, Pak Jong Chon y Ju To Hyon.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un recorre campo de construccion de viviendas de cientificos
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un recorre campo de construccion de viviendas de cientificos
						
Pyongyang, 2 de julio (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, recorrio el campo de construccion de viviendas de los cientificos en el suburbio de esta capital.
					Las viviendas que se construyen de modo especifico son el regalo del Mariscal para los cientificos.
					
					En esa zona se levantaran las viviendas de varios pisos para mil familias, edificios publicos e instalaciones de servicio publico.
					
					Recorriendo el campo de construccion, el Mariscal hizo detallado conocimiento del estado de la obra.
					
					Contemplando con satisfaccion las viviendas que en la llanura se levantan con rapidez, dijo que son muy elegantes las viviendas y evaluo el hecho de que los constructores militares hayan hecho bien la obra de acuerdo con la demanda del diseno.
					
					Subrayando que es importante en la construccion el arreglo simultaneo de los alrededores  de viviendas, senalo que al prestar atencion al acondicionamiento de la zona y realizar al mismo tiempo la creacion de area verde inclusive la plantacion de arboles deben eliminar todas las huellas de construccion con la culminacion de la obra.
					
					Al averiguar el estado de marcha de la construccion de los edificios publicos inclusive escuela, jardin infantil y hospital e instalaciones de servicio publico, destaco la necesidad de impulsar la construccion segun el plan concentrando las fuerzas en los objetos en la etapa culminante.
					
					Mirando el parque que se construye en la zona de viviendas, hablo de que los habitantes, jovenes y ninos gustan mucho por haber remodelado los parques de la ciudad de Pyongyang y subrayo que hace falta acondicionarlos con excelencia para que la zona de viviendas de cientificos sea modelo en el arreglo de area de viviendas.
					
					Y el Mariscal dio vuelta por las viviendas que tienen dos familias en un piso.
					
					Destaco que las viviendas fueron disenadas bien y garantizadas en un nivel alto la obra y evaluo otra vez las proezas de los constructores militares.
					
					Senalo que es notable el exito en la edificacion en un corto plazo de las viviendas tan excelentes como aquellas y agrego que deben romper la velocidad de construccion de la decada de 1970, lo que es la "velocidad Masikryong" propuesta por el partido.
					
					Tras recibir el parte de que los constructores militares realizan la construccion de acuerdo con el plan en la zona mas dificil, senalo que cada vez que se presentan las dificultades, va a ver primero a los militares del ejercito popular y les da la orden con gusto.
					
					Se refirio a que deben ofrecer primordial atencion a la calidad de la obra y anadio que deben entregar a los cientificos las viviendas perfectas para satisfacerlos a quienes se mudan.
					
					Subrayo que el presente ano es el de los cientificos que con los exitos cientificos y tecnicos demostraron a todo el mundo la dignidad del pais y el poderio nacional y agrego que no hay nada de escatimar para los cientificos que verificaron con la practica la justeza de la politica del PTC de dar importancia a la ciencia y la tecnica.
					
					Instruyo que los cuadros del Comite Central del PTC y el Consejo de Ministros vayan al campo de construccion para conocer del estado de la obra, balancear el proceso de la obra por dias, semanas y meses y tomar las medidas necesarias, para que no haya la obra no acabada.
					
					Subrayo que visitara a menudo al campo de construccion para averiguar el estado de construccion y agrego que se entregaran las viviendas a los cientificos luego de aprobarse segun su norma.
					
					Ordeno terminar magnificamente la obra digna de ser alarde a todo el mundo hasta el Dia del Songun en que el Dirigente Kim Jong Il emprendio la direccion sobre la revolucion mediante el Songun. 
					
					Le acompanaron Choe Hwi, Pak Thae Song, Hwang Pyong So, Hong Yong Chil, Ma Won Chun, Yun Tong Hyon, Pak Jong Chon y Ju To Hyon.

articles.title: Conversan en La Habana delegaciones militares de Corea y Cuba
articles.content:
Conversan en La Habana delegaciones militares de Corea y Cuba
						
La Habana, 1 de julio (ACNC) -- Tuvieron lugar el 30 de junio en esta capital las conversaciones entre la delegacion militar de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y la de la Republica de Cuba.
					Por la parte coreana, participaron en la ocasion los miembros de la delegacion coreana encabezada por Kim Kyok Sik, jefe del Estado Mayor General del Ejercito Popular de Corea, el embajador Jon Yong Jin y el agregado militar de la embajada coreana en Cuba y por la cubana, Leopoldo Cintra Frias, ministro de las FAR, y otros funcionarios.
					
					Ambas partes informaron la situacion de los respectivos paises e intercambiaron criterios sobre el mayor desarrollo de las relaciones de amistad entre ambos ejercitos y pueblos.
					
					Las conversaciones transcurrieron en un ambiente camaraderil y amistoso.
